thread.title: Button up and boogie: Flannel Fest brings the heat to Wisconsin
thread.title_full: Button up and boogie: Flannel Fest brings the heat to Wisconsin

author: Georgiana Karl
title: Button up and boogie: Flannel Fest brings the heat to Wisconsin
text:
(WFRV)- There is a pretty “cool” music lineup meant to keep Wisconsinites in need “warm.”
In this segment, Erik Kjelland with Flannel Fest, discusses what Flannel Fest is, what you can expect from attending, and if you need to wear your flannel or not. He also shares the rundown, featuring some of Wisconsin’s most talented and decorated Wisco-Americana artists as well as artists from across the country.
Erik talks about Flannel Fest partnering up with the Keep Wisconsin Warm/Cool Fund (KWW/CF). This is a statewide non-profit initiative dedicated to providing essential heating and cooling services to thousands of elderly, disabled individuals, veterans, and working families with young children in crisis. KWW/CF offers preventative services and financial assistance to prevent energy-related emergencies. Erik shares that through the generosity of sponsors, matching grants, and dedicated attendees, Flannel Fest has raised over $169,000 for KWW/CF.
Flannel Fest is on Friday, November 21st, at the Barrymore Theatre in Madison, WI, and Saturday, November 22nd, at Tanner’s Grill & Bar in Kimberly, WI.
For more information about the Keep Wisconsin Warm/Cool Fund (KWW/CF), head to kwwf.org. For more information about Flannel Fest or to purchase tickets to the event, head to flannelfest.com.
